overview: Varanasi, also known as Benares or Kashi, is a historic city on the banks of the Ganges in Uttar Pradesh, India. It is the most sacred pilgrimage destination for Hindus, Jains and an important site for Buddhists, and is one of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world.
bestTimeToVisit: October – March (cooler months; bring warm clothing for chilly evenings)
topAttractions: Ghats along the Ganges River (e.g., Dashashwamedh, Assi)
travelTips: Walk is the best way to explore the ghats and waterfront; be prepared for heat and crowds.
Cycle‑rickshaws and auto‑rickshaws are cheap (short rides < ₹50, longer rides ≈ ₹100).
Carry a small guide or map of the ghats; signs are often in Roman letters.
Dress in layers: days can be hot while evenings become chilly between October and March.
Budget buses from nearby cities (e.g., Lucknow, Gorakhpur) cost ₹100‑₹250; trains are also economical.
Stay in budget guesthouses or hostels; meals at local eateries are typically ₹150‑₹250 per day.
